medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 6 months before admission, vague symptoms developed, including nausea, metallic taste, headache, throat pain, chest discomfort, and indigestion. Symptoms increased in intensity leading up to admission, particularly throat, chest, and epigastric discomfort that was aggravated when supine and interrupted her sleep. Generalized malaise was also reported for 1 week prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Type 2 diabetes mellitus diagnosed approximately 3.5 years before admission, previously well-controlled until one year prior when glucose levels became increasingly difficult to control. Past surgeries include bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy for an ovarian cystic teratoma 6 years ago and lithotripsy for nephrolithiasis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had transient ischemic attacks; father had heart disease, renal failure with minimal-change disease, borderline diabetes mellitus, and a family history of colon cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Lives alone, works at a health care facility. Does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
